column2:
character
  1. The first letter of the Fijian alphabet, written in the Latin script.

name
  1. England (a constituent country of the United Kingdom)

name
  1. Newcastle (a city in New South Wales, Australia)
  2. Any other city called Newcastle

name
  1. Sydney (the capital of New South Wales, Australia).

name
  1. Scotland (a constituent country of the United Kingdom)

noun
  1. a female (also, yalewa)

adj
  1. female
  2. womanlike, feminine (use vakayalewa to specify connotation)

pron
  1. I (personal pronoun)
  2. me (direct object of a verb)
  3. me (object of a preposition)
  4. me (indirect object of a verb)
  5. my (belonging to me)

verb
  1. to split with axe or heavy knife

noun
  1. hill (elevated location)
  2. mound on which yam is planted

character
  1. The third letter of the Fijian alphabet, written in the Latin script.

noun
  1. a measurement based on the hand, a span

verb
  1. to do, to make
  2. (transitive) to work

noun
  1. deed, doing, work, action
  2. affair, business
  3. effort, performance, exertion, workmanship
  4. occupation, employmentogaoga?, labor, service,
  5. function, use
  6. servitude
  7. avocation

character
  1. The fourth letter of the Fijian alphabet, written in the Latin script.

noun
  1. truth

adj
  1. true
  2. authentic, genuine, sincere
  3. worthy
  4. faithful, trustworthy
  5. effective, effectual, efficient, efficacious
  6. doubtless, valid

verb
  1. to believe
  2. to obey, to fulfill
  3. to credit

verb
  1. (intransitive) to creep, to crawl (used to refer to creatures without legs)

noun
  1. sugar cane (species of grass whose sap is a source of sugar)

noun
  1. fog (cloud that forms at a low altitude and obscures vision)

noun
  1. Someone "from the land of the foreigners", usually referring to a Caucasian from the United States, European or Australasian.

verb
  1. to dig (to move hard-packed earth out of the way)

prep
  1. to, for, towards (used for common nouns and names of places)
  2. at (used for locations)

adv
  1. therein, herein
  2. because of, for the sake of, thereby, hereby, herewith
  3. therefore (at the end of a statement or sentence, preceded by o koya o qo)

noun
  1. town
  2. village (use koro lailai to specify that it's smaller in size than a town)
  3. settlement

pron
  1. third person singular; he, she or singular they

noun
  1. skin (outer covering of the body of a person)

verb
  1. (intransitive) to come (to move from further away to nearer to)

prep
  1. in
  2. from

verb
  1. to skim a stone, to skip a rock

noun
  1. sign, omen
  2. miracle, wonder (use cakamana to specify this meaning)
  3. antidote (use mana kina to specify this meaning)
  4. (biblical) manna

adv
  1. so be it, let it be so (addressed to a heathen deity)

noun
  1. mosquito (small flying insect of the family Culicidae, known for biting and sucking blood)

adj
  1. afloat, adrift (more specifically, sa nawa)

verb
  1. to float, to drift

noun
  1. a monarch or honorific title used by Fijians of chiefly rank for males

verb
  1. (intransitive) to hear (to perceive with the ear)
  2. (transitive) to hear (to perceive with the ear)
  3. (intransitive) to listen (to pay attention to a sound)
  4. (intransitive) to listen (to wait for a sound)
  5. (intransitive) to listen (to accept oral instruction)

noun
  1. path (a trail for the use of, or worn by, pedestrians)
  2. path (a course taken)
  3. road (a way for travel)
  4. road (a path in life)
  5. street (paved part of road in a village or a town)

adv
  1. very, exceedingly (after adjectives)
  2. immediately, directly (after verbs)
  3. quite, wholly, entirely

adj
  1. astray, wandering (often referring to a person's mind)

noun
  1. day
  2. sun ( use mata ni siga [lit. "day's face"] to specify meaning)

noun
  1. atonement
  2. atonement offering (something sacrificed for atonement to occur)

verb
  1. (intransitive) to cry, to weep, to lament

noun
  1. (transitive) to mourn

verb
  1. (transitive) to touch, to take hold of
  2. (intransitive, tara-va) to follow, to succeed, to come after

adv
  1. un-, a-, dis-, il-, im-, in-, non- (functions similar to a negative English prefix)

adj
  1. inhabited
  2. filled

verb
  1. (transitive) to inhabit, to populate

noun
  1. booty, spoils (of war)
  2. trophy

verb
  1. to remove one's goods from one's home

verb
  1. to stand
  2. to be (only in situations regarding posture or position)

noun
  1. ray (marine fish with a flat body, large wing-like fins, and a whip-like tail)

noun
  1. a person assigned male at birth who behaves like a woman

noun
  1. war
  2. warfare
  3. warriors

verb
  1. to make war, to be at war

noun
  1. dress (article of clothing traditionally worn by women)

verb
  1. to buy, to purchase
  2. to redeem, to ransom
  3. to compensate

noun
  1. pig
  2. sow (more properly, vuaka tinatina)
  3. boar (more properly, a vuaka tagane)
  4. bacon (more properly, vuaka sa vakamasimataki)
  5. pork (more properly, lewe ni vuaka)

noun
  1. moon (largest natural satellite of planet Earth)
  2. moon (any substantially sized natural satellite of a planet)
  3. month

adj
  1. white

noun
  1. tear (drop of clear salty liquid from the eyes)

noun
  1. spouse
  2. husband, bridegroom, groom (wati tagane, to specify of the male sex)
  3. wife, bride (wati alewa, to specify of the female sex)
  4. consort
  5. brother-in-law, sister-in-law

verb
  1. (intransitive) to creep, to crawl (used especially for insects and bugs)
